title: Understanding Second-Generation Antipsychotics
text: Second-generation antipsychotics, also known as atypical antipsychotics, are a class of medications used to treat psychiatric conditions. They are different from first-generation antipsychotics in their chemical structure and side effect profile.

title: Common Second-Generation Antipsychotics
text: Some well-known second-generation antipsychotics include aripiprazole and risperidone. These medications are often prescribed for conditions like schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

hintAnswer: aripiprazole, asenapine, brexpiprazole, cariprazine, clozapine, iloperidone, lumateperone, lurasidone, olanzapine, paliperidone, pimavanserin, quetiapine, risperidone, and ziprasidone
title: Identifying Second-Generation Antipsychotics
text: Which of the following lists contains only second-generation antipsychotics?
choices: aripiprazole, asenapine, brexpiprazole, cariprazine, clozapine, iloperidone, lumateperone, lurasidone, olanzapine, paliperidone, pimavanserin, quetiapine, risperidone, and ziprasidone
